channel.title: The Pudding
channel.description: The Pudding is an editorial publication that explains ideas debated in culture with visual essays.

item.title: Do Authors Write Where They Know?
item.description: Examining how far authors set their books from where they’ve lived.

item.title: Where International Communities Cluster
item.description: America has often been called a nation of immigrants. Here's where they settled.

item.title: The Aftermath of a YouTube Apology
item.description: Quantifying the lasting impact of a YouTube controversy.

item.title: The Pudding Cup 2019
item.description: The best visual and data-driven stories of 2019

item.title: The Worst, Highest-Paid NBA Player, Ever
item.description: Using advanced NBA stats to rank player performance against pay.

item.title: The Big Data of Big Hair
item.description: Investigating when big hair was at its height.

item.title: Laughing OnLine
item.description: Exploring the usage, evolution, and perception of digital laughter.

item.title: The Kim Foxx Effect
item.description: Measuring the data behind a promise to transform prosecution.

item.title: Where Do Adoptable Dogs in Your State Come From?
item.description: It may be further than you think.

item.title: Ye Olde Mad-Lib Pub Crawl Generator
item.description: Finding the shortest route between UK pubs of the same name.

item.title: Is “Ass” the Most Complicated Word in English?
item.description: An investigation into the mutability of slang.

item.title: The Millennial Question
item.description: How does popular media see our generation?

item.title: The Language of Congress
item.description: What topics do members of Congress tweet about most frequently?

item.title: Are Men Singing Higher in Pop Music?
item.description: Men’s voices in pop music seem really high. When was vocal register the highest?

item.title: Top-Selling Book Covers, Arranged by Visual Similarity
item.description: An interactive map of over 5,000 book covers, organized by machine learning
